intro: Serapias nitida, commonly known as the slender serapias, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-orange flowers with a distinctive hooded shape. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Serapias nitida is a perennial species, producing flowers from late spring to early summer.
